    Notes

    Notes #

    Purpose of mvn clean: if the name of a file was changed, then the compiled version of the file with the previous name remains in the target folder.

    Maven:

    • has an easier learning curve than Gradle,
    • is more widely used,
    • is less customizable
    • is less efficient (less advanced caching strategies)

    MAven does not suppo

    mvn dependency:analyze

    mvn dependency:tree

    validate: check if all information necessary for the build is available
compile: compile the source code
test-compile: compile the test source code
test: run unit tests
package: package compiled source code into the distributable format (jar, war, …)
integration-test: process and deploy the package if needed to run integration tests
install: install the package to a local repository
deploy: copy the package to the remote repository

    2.12. Maven and Git

    Which Maven files should you commit to your git repository?

    The pom.xml file.
Optionally, the Maven wrapper files.
    .mvn folder
    mvnw file
    mvnw.cmd folder

    Which should you ignore?

    The target folder.
Everything else that you generate during build.

    A POM can inherit properties from a parent POM.

    Super POM

    Maven's default POM.
All POMs extend the Super POM unless explicitly set.

    Effective POM

    The complete POM after inheriting properties.
